title: Pattern Matching
description:
Practice Rust's powerful `match` expression by implementing a grading system and day classifier.

## Requirements

### Part 1: Grade Calculator
Implement `score_to_grade(score: u32) -> char` that returns:
- `'A'` for scores 90-100
- `'B'` for scores 80-89
- `'C'` for scores 70-79
- `'D'` for scores 60-69
- `'F'` for scores 0-59

### Part 2: Day Classifier
Implement `day_type(day: &str) -> &str` that returns:
- `"Weekend"` for "Saturday" or "Sunday"
- `"Weekday"` for Monday through Friday
- `"Unknown"` for any other input

## Examples

- `score_to_grade(95)` returns `'A'`
- `score_to_grade(73)` returns `'C'`
- `day_type("Saturday")` returns `"Weekend"`
- `day_type("Wednesday")` returns `"Weekday"`
hints: The order of match arms matters - put more specific patterns before general ones
Use the | operator for alternatives: "Saturday" | "Sunday" matches either string
The _ pattern matches anything and is useful as a catch-all
For day_type, you can list all weekdays with |, or use _ for Unknown after matching weekend and specific weekdays
